intro: Adenocalymma verruciferum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems covered in rough, warty bumps, giving it its common name. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Adenocalymma verruciferum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
